content.prompt: â€‹The polynomial function P is given by Px=3xx+12x-a, where a is a real number. Which of the following could be the graph of y=Px ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.7 comma negative 3.5).
  • The curve increases to reach a high point at (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 0.3 comma negative 0.4).
  • The curve increases to pass through the origin and exit the window at (0.5 comma 3.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.3 comma negative 3.5).
  • The curve increases to cross the x axis at (negative 1 comma 0) and reach a high point at (negative 0.6 comma 1.2). 
  • The curve decreases to pass through the origin and reach a low point at (0.6 comma negative 1.2).
  • The curve increases to cross the x axis at (1 comma 0) and exit the window at (1.3 comma 3.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.2 comma 3.5).
  • The curve decreases to cross the x axis at (negative 1 comma 0) and reach a low point at (negative 0.9 comma negative 0.5). 
  • The curve increases to reach a high point at (negative 0.5 comma negative 0.2). 
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 0.1 comma negative 0.5).
  • The curve increases to pass through the origin and exit the window at (0.2 comma 3.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.7 comma 3.5).
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The curve increases to reach a high point at (negative 0.5 comma 0.2).
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at the origin. 
  • The curve increases to exit the window at (0.7 comma 3.5).
  • The curve appears to be symmetric about the vertical line x = negative 0.5.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
